history.content:
For now, you can put whatever prereq you're taking later as a "Tech Elective" and fill in the name of the prereq there. Everything else is mostly the same for early declaration students, so there's no real reason to have a specific early declaration form.

At the top it says:

  • If you have taken UCB equivalent class:
    • E7 instead of CS61A (only if approved by CS Advising): 
      How completed? - waived 
      Non-UCB Course# - E7
    • Math55 instead of CS70 (if you are Math Major) or 47B instead of CS61B: 
      How completed? - UCB Course 
      Non-UCB Course# - Math55, or 47B

At the top it says:

  • If you have taken UCB equivalent class:
    • E7 instead of CS61A (only if approved by CS Advising): 
      How completed? - waived 
      Non-UCB Course# - E7
    • Math55 instead of CS70 (if you are Math Major) or 47B instead of CS61B: 
      How completed? - UCB Course 
      Non-UCB Course# - Math55, or 47B
Please also remember to check the early declaration check box :)

Hi! I'm interested in applying for early declaration for CS. The online form I found here: 

https://deptapps.eecs.berkeley.edu/csapp/apply

is largely tailored for non-early declare students. It requires that I fill out my course information on 61C (which I'm taking next semester), and 61C isn't a choice I can put on my tentative schedule for Fall 2015. I'm also declaring a double in Applied Mathematics, so I can't replace CS70 with Math 55 on the form. Is there a physical application that I can fill out tailored to early declarers? Thanks so much!
history.subject: L&S CS Early Declaration Form
